title: Can you convert a legal separation into a divorce. if so, what would it cost it all agreements etc stayed the same.
question: don't want to be legally or financially responsible for other spouse asap. May decide to divorce latter. does process start all over?
answers: You can be " legally separated" without court action. A judgment of legal separation is not "ASAP".

You can amend prior to Judgment. You can do it once as a matter of course, and then otherwise, with leave of the court or by stipulation. See CCP 473.

If you already have a Judgment of Legal Separation, you are going to have to file a new case.
t

Do you currently have a legal separation judgment? Was a petition for legal separation filed and is it pending? In order to move into a dissolution, the current status of your case will determine what to do. If a judgment has been filed that actually separated the parties assets and debts, then you are now at least in theory not responsible for the other party's finances. But if no judgment is pending the outcome of a legal separation, then you would need to amend the current proceeding. If a judgment was filed, then you would need to file a new petition for dissolution. Strongly suggest you seek legal assistance on this from a skilled family law attorney.
You can amend your petition for dissolution of marriage if there is no legal separation judgment yet. If there is a judgment, you need to file a new action for dissolution of marriage.
